main.docTitle: Food Business Regulation (Exemption from Section 31(1)) Notice

editorialNote.content: The title of this Notice was amended from “Food Business (Regional Council) Bylaws (Exemption from Bylaw 31(1)) (Consolidation) Notice” to “Food Business Regulation (Exemption from section 31(1)) Notice” — see 78 of 1999 s. 7.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Exemptions from section 31(1)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: carries on the business of bottling or canning edible oil; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: carries on the business of a restaurant or of a siu mei and lo mei shop, and does so in—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a public market in a stall which he holds under a tenancy agreement with the Director of Food and Environmental Hygiene; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a private market as a licensed stallholder under the Private Markets Regulation (Cap. 132 sub. leg. BG); or (E.R. 4 of 2019)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: carries on the business of sorting, sifting, drying or repacking of tea; or (L.N. 105 of 1984; L.N. 100 of 1993)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: carries on the business of packing of rice, (L.N. 100 of 1993)

section.continued: is hereby exempted, to the extent of such business, from the obligation to hold a food business licence under section 31(1) of the Food Business Regulation (Cap. 132 sub. leg. X).
